intro: Acronychia trifoliolata var. microcarpa, commonly known as the small-fruited sandpaper fig, is a species of flowering plant in the family Burseraceae. It is native to northeastern Australia and is characterized by its rough, sandpaper-like bark and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, clustered fruits that are typically yellow or red when ripe. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in coastal and lowland rainforest areas. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
